title: Professional Course on Designing RTI-Based Science Learning Models for Students with Mild Intellectual Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: In-service secondary teachers practicing customized science learning strategies for students with mild intellectual disabilities in simulation environments, utilizing VR content via BYOD

learning_goals: Participants can design specific scenarios for applying the RTI three-tier model (Tier 1/2/3 interventions) to science instruction.
In a VR simulation environment, learners can analyze learning responses of students with mild intellectual disabilities and evaluate personalized intervention strategies with 80% accuracy.
Learners can continuously improve RTI-based science learning modules by incorporating feedback from instructional design experts.

resources: Learning Dataset for Students with Mild Intellectual Disabilities

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
